abstract: Kobani Journal; Syrian border town destroyed in Kurdish-led effort against Islamic State invasion struggles to rebuild; roads, hospitals and schools slowly reopen, despite scarcity of supplies and funding; some residents find themselves more attached to city than before, while others are still haunted by violence.
lead_paragraph: Less than a year after driving out the Islamic State, residents of the Kurdish border town in northern Syria are trying to rebuild homes and lives amid rubble.

headline.main: Town of Kobani, Scarred by ISIS, Strives to Rebuild
headline.print_headline: Syrian Town Where the Islamic State Was Repelled Now Strives to Rebuild

snippet: Less than a year after driving out the Islamic State, residents of the Kurdish border town in northern Syria are trying to rebuild homes and lives amid rubble.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
